subject: Boston Marathon
Marathon Running
lead_paragraph: Robert Cheruiyot of Kenya will compete for his fourth consecutive Boston Marathon title and Dire Tune of Ethiopia will return to defend her title in the women’s division in the 2009 race on April 20. Cheruiyot won his first Boston Marathon title in 2003, then won the race three consecutive years from 2006 to 2008. His time of 2 hours 7 minutes 14 seconds in 2006 established the course record. Dire won in Boston in 2008 by two seconds over Alevtina Biktimirova of Russia, the closest finish in the women’s division.
